choose to do determines the adventure you have and whether you get
back to the right size.

book_title: Help There's a Cat Washing in Here
Summary:
Twelve-year-old Henry takes charge of the family for two weeks to
allow his mother uninterrupted time to work on an art portfolio.

The reader is asked to make choices which will determine the fate of a
village.

Lucie finds her lost handkerchiefs at a strange washerwoman's
house.
A silly squirrel loses his tail in a riddle game.

While on a camping trip with your cousin, you, the reader, see a huge
creature holding your cousin in the air. Now you must choose how the
story will go.

One summer day, you and your best friend Hal are fishing at
Miller's Pond. Suddenly a large green creature with bulging eye
pops out of the water. You run, but it follows you home!

book_title: Cecily Parsley's Nursery Rhymes (An Ariel Book)
Summary:
Eight short nursery rhymes about Cecily Parsley, Goosey Gander, the
five pigs, Pussy-Cat, three blind mice, Tom Tinker's dog, a
garden, and Ninny Nanny Netticoat.

The Snow Dog was born in the wilderness and learned to master it until
his path crossed those of a black wolf and a man. The three meet in a
gripping, breathless climax.
A collection of fantastic tales for children.

You and your friend, Rodney, are exploring the Tower of London when
you are thrown into a dungeon. To get out, you have to make the right
choices.

A painfully shy young boy befriends a homeless baby ferret and gets as
much comfort as he gives.

Unusual things begin to happen at Good Day Orphanage when Miss Know It
All arrives with a box of Other-Way-Around pills.

You are hunting for a magical necklace that was buried in an Egyptian
tomb when you are confronted by two doors. Over one there is a curtain
of flames. You must decide what to do next.

An old Persian rug becomes a flying carpet which leads to a series of
magical adventures determined by choices made by the reader.

book_title: Anne of Green Gables (Anne of Green Gables Novels (Paperback))
Summary:
A young orphan struggles to adjust to the new experience of a
permanent home on Prince Edward Island.

When gorgeous, conceited Taffy Sinclair wins a part on a television
soap opera, eleven-year-old Jana's jealousy skyrockets until she
begins to mix television fantasy with real life.

While vacationing on a farm, three children find themselves
irresistibly drawn to an uninhabited island in the nearby lake
especially after they notice a mysterious boy waving to them from
there.

book_title: Encyclopedia Brown's Book of Wacky Animals (Encyclopedia Brown Books (Paperback))
Summary:
A collection of anecdotes chronicling some unusual events and
activities involving a variety of wild and domestic animals.

In The Dancing Cats of Applesap, everyone in the sleepy little town of
Applesap has deserted Jiggs' Drugstore for the new Super Queen --
everyone except shy Melba Morris, who likes crotchety Miss
Toomie's hot fudge sundaes and doesn't mind ...

book_title: Encyclopedia Brown and the Case of the Mysterious Handprints
Summary:
The ten-year-old detective continues his war on crime in Idaville
through ten more cases, for which the reader is invited to guess the
solution before it is revealed.

As author Jessica and artist Daphne collaborate on a picture book for
a seventh-grade English class contest, Jessica becomes aware of
conditions in Daphne's home life that seem to threaten her health
and safety.

Once again America's 10-year-old Sherlock Holmes in sneakers is
called upon to help his police-chief father and the neighborhood
children solve 10 mysteries.

book_title: MISS KNOW IT ALL AND THE GOOD DAY MICE
Summary:
When Frederick Mouse is kidnapped by humans, his family leave their
comfortable home to journey to the Good Day Orphanage for Girls at
Butterfield Square to search for him.

A fifth-grade boy running for school president is forced to make some
important decisions regarding the amount of manipulation he should
allow from his "genius" campaign manager.

Tired of the nagging of their mothers, Lorna Markham and Scotti
Wheeler, best friends and next-door neighbors, come up with a scheme
to exchange moms.

book_title: Mystery Cat and the Chocolate Trap
Summary:
Mystery Cat, a huge gray tomcat who belongs to both Kelly Ann McCoy
and Hillary Barnett, join forces with his two owners to outwit a
mysterious catnapper.

The twins' close friendship is threatened when Jessica is admitted
to an exclusive girls' club.

Problems erupt between the twins when Elizabeth and Jessica Wakefield
compete to perform a solo at the upcoming ballet recital, and Jessica
becomes jealous of their teacher's favoritism toward her sister.

An adventure story featuring a dog that disappears into an abandoned,
possibly haunted, house. The reader makes choices throughout the story
which will determine the outcome.

A boy and an Irish setter wander over wilderness trails, hunt
together, and fight for their lives against a killer bear.
Trick or treating is a new game for a real little witch.

Zucchini, an independent young ferret, escapes from the Bronx Zoo,
sets out to journey to the Oklahoma prairie, and ends up at the ASPCA,
where he meets a new friend.

The twins find themselves on different sides in their investigation
into the mystery of the supposedly haunted Mercandy mansion as they
argue over whether or not Nora Mercandy is a witch.

While thirteen-year-old Johnny Dixon lies dying, possessed by an evil
spirit, his friends, an elderly professor and a schoolmate, try to
find some way to free him.

book_title: Haunted Halloween Party (Choose Your Own Adventure, No 37)
Summary:
Invited to a Halloween party at an eerie old mansion, the reader ends
up at a celebration at which the guests are real ghosts, goblins, and
witches.

What happens when, one by one, the children disobey Mr. Wonka's
orders? In Dahl's most popular story, the nasty are punished and
the good are deliciously, sumptuously rewarded. "From the
Hardcover edition."

Is Elizabeth's best friend more important than her own twin
sister.

Stormy, a black retriever, befriends Allan Marley, living alone while
his father serves a prison sentence.

Determined to see her favorite rock band after her parents forbid it,
Jessica plans an elaborate scheme that backfires and Elizabeth must
find a way to save her sister.

book_title: The New Girl (Sweet Valley Twins, No 6)
Summary: "How can twin sisters cause triple trouble?"

Pampered ten-year-old Arabella thinks that by becoming a cat, she can
avoid being sent to boarding school by her mother's fourth
husband, but she finds her new life fraught with unknown terrors and
learns that her former life was not so bad ...

A class assignment to write an essay on "My Future Career"
leads Alice Whipple to take up art as an assistant to the eccentric
and mysterious Miss Slade, a job that leads her to her true calling--
that of a world-famous detective.

After his master dies, a champion greyhound chooses the freedom of the
desert where his ready intellect is continually challenged in the
battle against thirst, hunger, and natural enemies.

Elizabeth Wakefield loves horses so much that she'll do almost
anything to be allowed to ride Thunder, from pretending to be friends
with Lila, his owner, to betraying her twin and her best friend.

book_title: Against the Rules (Sweet Valley Twins, No 9)
Summary: Vol. 9.

book_title: Encyclopedia Brown Gets His Man (America's Sherlock Holmes in Sneakers, No. 4)
Summary:
The Sherlock Holmes of Idaville, Encyclopedia Brown solves another set
of mysteries with his usual style and resourcefulness.

book_title: One of the Gang (Sweet Valley Twins, 10)
Summary:
Pamela Robinson gains a new understanding of herself and her handicap
when she comes to the aid of a friend, Jessica Wakefield, after an
ankle injury threatens to put Jessica out of the Sweet Valley Mini-
Olympics.

Jessica and her friend Ellen discover an old metal box buried in
Ellen's backyard with two hundred dollars in it.

book_title: Miss Know It All and the Wishing Lamp
Summary:
Miss Know It All is forced to come to the rescue when the discovery of
a magical wishing lamp leads to trouble at the Good Day Orphanage for
Girls.

book_title: JANET HAMM NEEDS A DATE FOR THE DANCE
Summary:
Peer pressure and the lack of a date for the seventh grade dance lead
Janet Hamm to inventing a date, but she finds her dishonesty brings
complications.

Elizabeth faces a crisis of conscience when Jessica reveals the secret
language their father had taught them--and the twins had promised to
keep secret--and the class plans to use it against an unpopular
teacher.

Ten mysteries for ten-year-old Encyclopedia Brown, his partner, Sally,
and the reader to solve. Solutions are given at the back of the book

Jana finds a wallet but decides to return it to where she found it -
that's when Taffy sees her and blackmails her into becoming her
personal slave.

Wolfgang Amadeus Mazart helps Inspector LeChat catch the thief who is
stealing all the muffins of Europe.
Vol. 15.

The adventures of a dog born in the wilderness, left to fend for
himself when a black wolf kills his mother and brothers, and finally
won over by the trapper his mother had deserted.

book_title: You See the Future (Choose Your Own Adventure No 44)
Summary:
The reader's decisions will determine what happens when a bump on
the head leaves the reader with the ability to see the future.

Jessica and Peter Blake convince their parents to buy an antique
dollhouse that turns out to be inhabited by the Picolini family, tiny
circus figures who come alive and lead the children into a bizarre
mystery.

While visiting the site of sacred cave painting in the middle of the
Australian outback, John Midas slips back thousands of years and finds
himself among a prehistoric aboriginal tribe.
Originally published: London: J. Cape, 1980.
Milo will do anything to be perfect.

Jana Morgan and her club, The Fabulous Five, set out to uncover the
identity of Jana's secret admirer.

The adventures of two owls who shake up an entire neighborhood and
turn a house topsy-turvy. Copyright © Libri GmbH. All rights reserved.

book_title: Class Trip (Sweet Valley Twins Super Edition, No 1)
Summary:
On the day of the big sixth-grade class trip to the Emerald Forest,
Jessica and Elizabeth have a big argument, but when Elizabeth decides
it is time to make up, Jessica is nowhere to be found.

Twelve-year-old Betsy's animosity toward her new stepsister,
Ferris, increases when Betsy must abandon her dream of owning a horse
because the family can no longer afford it, but Ferris is allowed to
continue with her music lessons.

Carole and Stevie are happy to find that Lisa, the new student at Pine
Hollow Stables, shares their enthusiasm for riding and horses and, as
their friendship grows, the three girls decide to form the Saddle
Club.
How do you stop the meanest kid in Sweet Valley?

Seth and Daniel's camping trip to a lonely mountaintop becomes a
journey into a painful past that Daniel must confront.

book_title: The Kidnapping of Courtney Van Allen and What'S-Her-Name
Summary:
Twelve-year-old Courtney Van Allen--rich, famous, and rebellious--and
her new friend, Jan Travis--also twelve, but neither rich nor famous--
are abducted by two very peculiar kidnappers.

book_title: Encyclopedia Brown's Book of the Wacky Outdoors (Encyclopedia Brown Books (Paperback))
Summary:
A collection of humorous anecdotes, most of which are true, about
outdoor life, with an emphasis on fishing and hunting.

A gift of a toy castle, complete with silver knight, introduces
William to an adventure involving magic and a personal quest.

Jessica and Lila cut school to meet their favorite soap opera star,
Kent Kellerman, only to find that the punishment for their misdeed has
unexpected consequences.

During the last week of school at Mark Twain Elementary, the sixth
grade boys switch around the contents of everyone's locker, and
Taffy Sinclair's personal diary winds up in less than friendly
hands.

Here, Zucchini meets Billy. Billy loves animals, and he loves Zucchini
especially. But Billy is shy, much too shy to show Zucchini how much
he loves him. A misunderstanding makes Zucchini feel rejected and
hurt.

When Sarah's father has to go to Texas on business, he leaves her
in the care of Annie, his fiance, never dreaming that Annie would
leave Sarah alone most of the week.

The three members of the Saddle Club--Carole, Lisa, and Stevie--are
the best of friends, bonded by their special love of horses.

book_title: A Day With the Dinosaurs (Choose Your Own Adventure, Skylark, No 46)
Summary:
After accidentally stumbling into a hole, the reader is hurled back
one hundred million years into the past, where a fierce Tyrannosaurus
Rex and other dangerous dinosaurs threaten to attack.

One day, the horse Gretchen was riding strayed far away from the wagon
train, leaving Gretchen lost and all alone. But then a magnificent
white stallion appeared.

A lively, too helpful ghost of an old man named Malcolm causes all
kinds of trouble for ten-year-old Scott after he and his family move
into a house in Chagrin Falls.

book_title: Claim to Fame (Sweet Valley Twins, No 23)
Summary:
Jessica and Elizabeth Wakefield compete on opposing sides in a
schoolwide contest to determine what should go into a time capsule
being buried to celebrate the 25th anniversary of Sweet Valley Middle
School.

book_title: The Trouble With Flirting (Fabulous Five : Book, No 2)
Summary:
"Helpful" tips on flirting found in a teen magazine work all
too well for Melanie Edwards, who soon has three boyfriends, one of
whom thinks she's someone else.

book_title: JUMPING TO CONCLUSIONS (Sweet Valley Twins, No 24)
Summary:
Elizabeth and Jessica Wakefield, along with their brother Steven,
suspect their mother of having an affair with a younger man, and they
are determined to find out the truth

book_title: The Enchanted Attic (Choose  Your Own Adventure, No. 52)
Summary:
While exploring an old attic, the reader comes across an old trunk
containing a photo album that acts as a time machine, and soon the
reader must negotiate his/her way through the past. Original.

The members of the Saddle Club look forward to the upcoming Pine
Hollow Stables's gymkhana, and Carole Hanson introduces the rest
of the club to her new friend, Kate Devine.

A boy acquires a magical gift that turns everything his lips touch
into chocolate.

Vowing after an unfair detention that she will always listen to both
sides of a story, Katie Shannon finds her resolve tested when she is
appointed as a judge on Wakeman Junior High's new Teen Court.

The Sweet Valley Middle School choral group is off to Washington,
D.C., for a singing competition, but members Jessica and Elizabeth
Wakefield also become involved in a plot to reunite their friend Anna
with her long-lost sister.

Eighth-grader Aviva Granger spends a confusing Christmas with both new
families of her recently divorced parents, experiencing a hectic but
happy holiday season.

When Jana has an argument with her four best friends, she acts
friendly toward the hated Taffy Sinclair in order to get back at them.

book_title: The Ghost in the Third Row
Summary:
Sixth-grader Nina Tanleven is delighted when she gets a part in a
community theater production, but she soon becomes puzzled by the
appearance of a beautiful woman in white--that only she can see.

book_title: Encyclopedia Brown and the Case of the Treasure Hunt (Encyclopedia Brown (Paperback))
Summary:
America's Sherlock Holmes in sneakers continues his war on crime
in ten more cases, the solutions to which are found in the back of the
book.

The twins' close friendship is threatened when Jessica is admitted
to an exclusive girls' club.

Problems erupt between the twins when Elizabeth and Jessica Wakefield
compete to perform a solo at the upcoming ballet recital, and Jessica
becomes jealous of their teacher's favoritism toward her sister.

The twins find themselves on different sides in their investigation
into the mystery of the supposedly haunted Mercandy mansion as they
argue over whether or not Nora Mercandy is a witch.

Elizabeth Wakefield finds herself torn between her sister and her best
friend, Amy Sutton, when Amy tries out for the Unicorn Club's
cheering squad and the Unicorns, including Jessica Wakefield, will do
anything to keep her off the squad.

Determined to see her favorite rock band after her parents forbid it,
Jessica plans an elaborate scheme that backfires and Elizabeth must
find a way to save her sister.

book_title: The New Girl (Sweet Valley Twins, No 6)
Summary:
Identical twins Elizabeth and Jessica play tricks on the new girl
until Elizabeth discovers why she has been so mean to everyone.

book_title: Three's a Crowd (Sweet Valley Twins, No 7)
Summary:
Sixth grader Mary Giaccio, a foster child yearning for her real
mother, tries to substitute Mrs. Wakefield for her mother, but those
attempts may jeopardize her friendship with Jessica and Elizabeth.

Elizabeth Wakefield loves horses so much that she'll do almost
anything to be allowed to ride Thunder, from pretending to be friends
with Lila, his owner, to betraying her twin and her best friend.

book_title: Tug of War (Sweet Valley Twins, No 14)
Summary:
Twin sisters Elizabeth and Jessica Wakefield find themselves running
against each other for sixth-grade president and discover that one of
them will have to drop out of the campaign in order to preserve their
relationship.

book_title: The Older Boy (Sweet Valley Twins, No 15)
Summary:
When twelve-year-old Jessica Wakefield finally meets the boy of her
dreams, sixteen-year-old Josh Angler, she could not be happier--except
that Jessica knows her parents would never approve of their dating,
and Josh doesn't know her real ...

Jessica and Elizabeth have their share of problems, but they
aren't half as bad as those of their classmate, Patrick Morris.

Jana wonders if she can really trust her old enemy Taffy, who now says
she wants to be friends.

Tired of the nagging of their mothers, Lorna Markham and Scotti
Wheeler, best friends and next-door neighbors, come up with a scheme
to exchange moms.

book_title: Against the Rules (Sweet Valley Twins, No 9)
Summary:
Despite the disapproval of her parents and friends, Elizabeth plans a
secret birthday party for her talented but poverty-stricken friend,
Sophia Rizzo.

book_title: The Haunted House (Choose Your Own Adventure, 2)
Summary:
Readers make choices that determine the outcome of the story when
Homer, a dog, wanders into a haunted house.

book_title: The Green Slime (Choose Your Own Adventure)
Summary:
Every young reader can join Cousin Stevie in causing a chemistry set
to go crazy and fill the house with bubbling green slime, in an
adventure with several possible outcomes.

Determined to earn the bus fare needed to visit their great-aunt, the
Wakefield twin take up dog-sitting and are soon torn between reporting
an abused dog and remaining silent--profitably.

The Wakefield twins' April Fool's Day joke turns out a bit
unexpectedly as Elizabeth must take the blame for things her sister
does wrong.

Jessica Wakefield and her best friend, Ellen Riteman, find themselves
in trouble when their discovery of a metal box containing letters,
photographs and money--buried in Ellen's backyard--coincides with
the theft of class trip money from ...

Jana finds a wallet but decides to return it to where she found it -
that's when Taffy sees her and blackmails her into becoming her
personal slave.

book_title: JESSICA AND THE BRAT ATTACK (Sweet Valley Twins, No 29)
Summary:
Jessica Wakefield steals a baby-sitting job from her twin sister
Elizabeth, leaving Elizabeth the boring job of tending the water-
balloon booth at the school fair, but when Jessica's charge proves
too rambunctious, she wonders whether ...

Though her father seems to despise the wild horses that roam near
their Wyoming sheep ranch, twelve-year-old Tracy is determined to
nurse one found in a coyote trap back to health.

Carole, Stevie, and Lisa are members of the Saddle club and are best
friends, but Carole is having trouble coping with the attentions her
widowed father is giving a woman whom she thinks might become her
stepmother.

book_title: The Big Camp Secret (Sweet Valley Twins, No 3/Super Edition)
Summary:
Elizabeth and Jessica head for camp and begin a busy schedule of
meeting boys, going horseback riding, and making new friends, but when
their friend Grace shows up, and they agree to hide her, the trouble
begins.

Offended by Taffy Sinclair's snobbishness and jealous of her
developing figure, Jana Morgan and her friends form a club to do
something about it.

book_title: Taffy Sinclair, Baby Ashley, and Me
Summary:
Classroom rivals Taffy and Jana are sent to the principal's office
for yet another fight, but their antagonistic attitudes toward each
other may change forever when they discover an abandoned baby.

Shawnie runs away from home and her new friend Katie Shannon takes her
in, but while rooming with Shawnie, Katie gradually discovers that the
awful stories of Shawnie's home life may not be accurate.

book_title: Encyclopedia Brown Tracks Them Down (Encyclopedia Brown (Paperback))
Summary:
Encyclopedia Brown, boy detective, solves ten more mysteries. The
solutions are given at the end of the book.

Fifth-grader "Encyclopedia" Leroy Brown solves ten mysteries
and, by putting the solutions at the back of the book, challenges the
reader to do the same.

book_title: Encyclopedia Brown Finds the Clues (Encyclopedia Brown (Paperback))
Summary:
The essential facts of ten mysteries are presented, giving the reader
the opportunity to solve the cases before examining the boy
detective's solutions.

book_title: JESSICA'S BAD IDEA (Sweet Valley Twins, No 31)
Summary:
Jessica feels like a latter-day Victor Frankenstein when she suggests
a makeover for her friend Sandra Ferris, whose newfound popularity
then threatens Jessica's own social standing.

In order to improve Dawn's sister's love life, Dawn and her
cousin Jennifer create a love potion, but problems ensue when the
potion somehow gets into the faculty lounge and all the teachers
become lovesick.

book_title: Encyclopedia Brown and the Case of the Secret Pitch (Encyclopedia Brown (Paperback))
Summary:
A ten-year-old boy opens a private detective agency and works on ten
cases, challenging readers to find the solutions themselves.

book_title: Encyclopedia Brown and the Case of the Midnight Visitor (Encyclopedia Brown (Paperback))
Summary:
Idaville's boy detective applies concepts from history, science,
and the study of human behavior to the known facts in ten perplexing
cases.

book_title: Jessica on Stage (Sweet Valley Twins, No 32)
Summary:
Jessica's dream of becoming an actress is fueled by the discovery
that Sweet Valley's own Mrs. Harrington is really Dolores Dufay,
former star of stage and screen

book_title: ELIZABETH'S NEW HERO (Sweet Valley Twins, No 33)
Summary:
While hosting Kristoff, a member of a team of East German gymnasts,
the Wakefields find themselves embroiled in international politics
when their guest decides to defect.

Fearing that their new riding instructor is in serious financial
difficulty and that Pine Hollow Stables will be lost, the Saddle Club
goes into action to drum up new business and to arrange a riding show.

Malcolm the ghost comes to the rescue to help Scott win friends at his
new school.

Jessica, the twin of Elizabeth, hates hamsters, but has to take care
of Tinkerbell the class hamster during the school vacation, and when
Tinkerbell escapes consternation reigns.

book_title: The Twins' Mystery Teacher (Sweet Valley Kids (Paperback))
Summary:
Paper airplanes and whoopie cushions are planned for the new
substitute when the second grade teacher becomes ill, but the twins
and their classmates are unprepared for the no-nonsense Mr. Marshall,
who plans on ruling with an iron fist.

book_title: The Friendship and the Gold Cadillac
Summary:
The friendship: Four children witness a confrontation between an
elderly black man and a white storekeeper in rural Mississippi in the
1930s.

book_title: Jessica, the Rock Star (Sweet Valley Twins, No 34)
Summary:
Wanting desperately to be a rock-and-roll star, the gratingly tone-
deaf and talentless Jessica hooks up with four cute boys to form a
band, making her sister wish she would become another rock-and-roll
casualty.

When three friends accompany their riding instructor to New York City
to attend an important horse show, they meet their favorite actor, who
asks them to help him learn to ride for his latest movie.

book_title: Amy's Pen Pal (Sweet Valley Twins, No 35)
Summary:
Amy Sutton suspects a case of mistaken identity when a surprise visit
from her pen pal Samantha reveals a girl who seems alien to the
letters she supposedly wrote.

When identical twins Jessica and Elizabeth have a sleepover in a tent
in their backyard, Lila, one of the twins' guests, seems worried
and embarrassed by a secret only she knows.

Jack Galaxy and his friends, space crime fighters, take on monster
burgers who are out to conquer the universe, and Jack must face their
vicious leader, the Big Bopper.

book_title: MARY IS MISSING (Sweet Valley Twins, No 36)
Summary:
The twins' close friendship in threatened when Jessica is admitted
to an exclusive girls' club.

book_title: War Between the Twins (Sweet Valley Twins, No 37)
Summary:
Upset that Elizabeth's newspaper, "The Sweet Valley
Sixers," does not give them enough coverage, Jessica's group,
the Unicorns, decides to start a newspaper of their own.

Lisa learns a valuable lesson about the power of the press when she
uses her column in a local newspaper as a vehicle for reporting
private information about her friends.

Upset about having to entertain her nerdy cousin Preston during the
weekend of the Winter Carnival, Dawn finds things even more difficult
when she loses control of her magical powers.

An elderly uncle given to occasional bouts of confusion causes the
Andersons to wonder if they are able to care for him or if he should
be sent to a nursing home.

book_title: Lois Strikes Back (Sweet Valley Twins, No. 38)
Summary:
Overweight Lois Waller overcomes her shyness and the intimidating
antics of bully Bruce Patman and rides in the bike-a-thon, but Bruce
is prepared to go to great lengths to see her lose.

After eagerly looking forward to riding camp and its shows and games,
the Saddle Club girls are surprised and discouraged when they learn
that the other riders are far more competitive than they had expected.

Although the first edition was published 20 years ago, this reissue is
sure to strike chords with youngsters of today. Copyright © Libri
GmbH. All rights reserved.

Johnny Dixon and Professor Childermass discover a trolley which
transports them back to Constantinople in 1453 as the Turks are
invading the Byzantine Empire.

When author Angela Daley comes to town, the Wakefield twins both enter
a story contest to vie for the opportunity to help Angela autograph
her books, but Jessica cheats and turns in a story that is not hers.

book_title: Ghost in the Graveyard (Sweet Valley Twins and Friends Super Chiller, No 2)
Summary:
Sam Sloane, a new boy in town, turns to Jessica and Elizabeth
Wakefield for help when eerie feelings of deja vu and an encounter
with a ghost who bears a striking resemblance to Sam overwhelm him.

book_title: DANNY MEANS TROUBLE (Sweet Valley Twins, No 40)
Summary:
While writing a story for the school newspaper about Danny, a star
runner and major troublemaker, Elizabeth Wakefield discovers the real
reason why Danny has been getting into trouble, and sets out to help
him without betraying his secret.

book_title: The Twins Get Caught (Sweet Valley Twins (Paperback))
Summary:
When their parents make the new teen club, the Hangout, off limits to
their children, Jessica and Elizabeth Wakefield are upset about
missing their friend Aaron Dallas' party at the club, but Jessica
comes up with the perfect scheme to get ...

Elizabeth Wakefield comes to the aid of Lois Waller, a young girl who
is afraid of everything and everybody, teaching Lois how to ride a
bicycle, stand up for herself, and cope with the other kids'
teasing.

book_title: The Ghost in the Attic (Haunting With Louisa, Book 1)
Summary:
When Dee Forest's mother dies, the girl is sent to live with her
aunt, where she befriends the ghost of a thirteen-year-old girl who
had died in 1890.

book_title: The Ghost in the Big Brass Bed
Summary:
When her job at an antique store sends her to old Miss Watson's
mansion to pick up an old wardrobe, sixth grader Nina Tanleven, along
with her best friend, Chris, discovers a grieving girl ghost.

book_title: The Ghost Show (Annie K's Theater, No 2)
Summary:
Nine-year-old playwright Annie K. gathers all her friends to put on a
Halloween play called "The Ghost Show" for the neighborhood,
in a story accompanied by a play for readers to perform and tips on
costumes and props.

Carole has not enjoyed Christmas since her mother died, but when the
local veterinarian hires her as a temporary assistant, her mood
improves.

Told to make a doll like a pilgrim for the Thanksgiving display at
school, Molly's Jewish mother dresses the doll as she herself
dressed before leaving Russia to seek religious freedom--much to
Molly's embarrassment.

book_title: The Amazing Adventure of Me, Myself and I (Who Is the Real Ira)
Summary:
Ira is in over his head when the camera he has purchased at a corner
shop begins making duplicate copies of him, and soon he is frantically
searching for a way out of his predicament.
Trouble brews when Elizabeth and Jessica fall for the same boy.

book_title: Amy Moves in (Sweet Valley Twins, No 44)
Summary:
When Amy Sutton's home is devastated by fire she moves in with
Elizabeth and Jessica Wakefield, but Elizabeth's relationship with
her best friend soon begins to wear thin when Amy begins telling
secrets about her.

Elizabeth and Jessica are at odds once again when Elizabeth tries out
for the co-ed soccer team, while Jessica is content to play with dolls
and take ballet lessons.

Melanie's big date with Shane Arrington is complicated by a visit
from her Grandma Edwards, whose well-meaning help could ruin
Melanie's Valentine's Day.

Lisa's enthusiasm about riding along the beaches of sunny San
Marco dims after she takes a few falls.

Jessica's scheming leads to trouble when she enters a contest to
win an all-expenses-paid trip to Paris and her exaggerated entry about
her "perfect" family leads to their selection as finalists.

book_title: Jessica the TV Star (Sweet Valley Kids, No 16)
Summary:
When Jessica pretends to be Elizabeth for a day, Todd Wilkins,
thinking that she is indeed Elizabeth, tells her a secret meant for
her sister.

book_title: Encyclopedia Brown and the Case of the Disgusting Sneakers
Summary:
America's Sherlock Holmes in sneakers continues his war on crime

This book presents the state-of-the-art in optimal filtering and

book_title: The Boys Are Back in Town
Summary:
Both dreading and looking forward to his tenth high school reunion,

Demonstrates the synergy of physical and spiritual healing to

UN Peacekeeper Major Catherine Li hides her true identity as an

book_title: The Complete Fairy Tales of the Brothers Grimm
Summary:
A new translation of 239 fairy tales collected by the Brothers Grimm.
Also includes a listing of their oral and/or literary sources.

At an exclusive boarding school in the late 1960's, an unnamed

American MIAs choose to remain missing after the end of the Vietnam

book_title: The Big Bad Wolf Tells All

Struggling writer Frank Matthews is delighted when Max, an arrogant

book_title: thepurplebook: The Definitive Guide to Exceptional Online Shopping

A guide to online shopping explores the best in Internet shopping

The stories of three people--modern-day Michael Kearney, a serial

During the icy winter of 1857, riverboat man Abner Marsh is made

book_title: Stephen Hawking Quest for a Theory of Ev
Summary:
This book is the splendid result. It is not a biography per se. It is
rather the story of one man's quest to find the 'Theory of
Everything'. In these pages you will encounter a multitude of
amazing paradoxes: Beginnings may be endings.

The story of Lilian Jordan - a born survivor - who at 30, decides to

themselves drawn to each other in spite of their ...

Hired as a construction worker by the virile Matt Hallahan, single mom

Pawning her diamond watch for enough money to run from a man who had

When handsome Tander Ellis enters Amnity Ames's crafts shop,
claiming he wants to take up needlepoint while recovering from knee

Tackling an intruder in the old moonshiner's cave, ex-Marine Max

book_title: Men of Ice: Frozen Idol (Loveswept, No 425)

Ten years after lovely gamine Bedelia Fronsby broke his heart, Dolph

Haunted by the woman who at first was only a voice in the darkness,

book_title: Silver Fox and the Red-Hot Dove (Loveswept, No 450)
Summary:
When Elena Petrovic, a member of a visiting Soviet delegation and

When Katie Reynolds' childhood pal, Bill Logan, returns to Cape

Dashing into a store for a Moon Pie, Cory Bright runs right into the

When his son tells him about Mad Sally, the "horribly ugly
witch" whose apples he'd tried to steal, handsome single

When Travis Cayou finally leaves the rodeo circuit, heading back to

Cassandra Lockland refuses to admit her attraction for I.J. Carlson, a

Myles Wellington, still grieving over the loss of his young wife, is

When she is fired from her government job, Louisa Brannigan is

When Max Decatur walks back into her life after eleven lonely years,

When bank manager Elizabeth Hammer is framed for embezzlement by a new

Stranded in the middle of nowhere by car trouble, writer Jake Gannon

When Storm Dalton, sexy quarterback and heartbreaker, throws her over

Intrigued by the sensual woman whose cause he has offered to support,

Assigned to act as liaison for visiting lecturer Jake Stratton, a

book_title: The Princess and the Pea (Loveswept, No 589)

Convinced that the only cure for her insomnia is the four-poster bed

Although he resents beging shipped off by his employer to run a small

book_title: Take a Chance on Love (Loveswept, No 646)
Summary:
Gambler Biff Fuller finds himself strongly attracted to Amanda

Ten years after she had broken off her engagement with the brash

When Deacon Brody returns to his hometown after setting hearts

While Robin McKenna nurses ailing reporter Patrick Brady back to

Although their families have long been adversaries, Gray Kincaid and

When Jason O'Keefe, a man out of her past, arrives at her cabin in

In Savannah to confront the man who destroyed his business, Razor Cody

Refusing to believe her friend's premonition that she will meet

Bunny Fletcher had come to Portland to help bail out Alec

book_title: A Man to Believe in (Loveswept, No 585)

At a costume party, Cori McLaughlin is pleasantly suprised to be

Years after Kary Lucas's girlhood fantasies of him have faded,

Brought to England by his father's mysterious plot, rancher

The annual Montgomery clan family reunion features a fake murder

Eager to get back to the job he loves--wildcatting--oil man Ryder

Retired police officer John Lomax enjoys the tranquility of rural

book_title: Men of Mysteries Past: The Trouble with Jared, Loveswept 619

When shy Sid Granger's good-looking friend expresses an interest

Fragile artist Jenny Love-Townsend awakens the passionate yearnings in

Seeking refuge from the pain of her past in an isolated house, Josie

Determined to punish his ex-wife, Chelsea Lockridge, for her betrayal,

Hired by Mariah Chandler to restore a family mansion, Jack McMillan

Jessica Langston battles with conflicting emotions when she discovers

Despite his attraction to beautiful Erin Lindsey and his growing

After bailing accused embezzler Arianna Rossini out of jail, rebel

After finding a baby abandoned in her car, Daisy Huntington is forced

Cass MacFarland discovers the unpredictable, brash Cody MacRae is back

A strikingly handsome and terribly serious young scientist is

Overcome by her feelings for a jeans-clad scoundrel cowboy, Savanna

Refusing to believe that a relationship with rogue Jack Stratford

When ex-cop Dusty O'Brian shares the inheritance of her aunt's

Deciding that his life is over, wounded quarterback Joe Armstrong

book_title: Mac's Angels: Sinner and Saint (Loveswept, No 791)

Entranced by a beautiful comatose woman who lacks the will to survive,

Luke Sinclair arrives on a secluded island in order to protect

As Alex Hastings courts her with rich gifts, delectable promises, and

Seeking revenge against his ex-wife, Brick Sullivan discovers that he

Returning to the isolated beach paradise of his past, Don Jacobs is

book_title: Angel on a Harley (Treasured Tales, No 775)

Facing the woman who claims she is carrying his child, Dalton McShane

act. Original.

book_title: Emma and the Handsome Devil (Loveswept, No. 743)
Summary:
Hoping that the co-owner of her chicken farm will sell out his portion

Emmy Lou McNally, an elementary school teacher in Hopeless, Arkansas,

Refusing to leave her home despite the danger of a forthcoming

book_title: The Three Musketeers: Midnight Heat (Loveswept, No 776)

Called the Predator, Dane Colbourne, an investigator who has never

Poking around in the refuse center for pieces for her metal

Protecting a set of legendary jewels, Michael Ann O'Donnell fears

With the help of customers and friends, Fannie Brisbane prepares to

Brash, arrogant filmmaker Sam Horne sets out to charm beautiful Brett

Running away to prevent anyone from being hurt by those who pursue

Original.

Searching for a missing person, detective Sullivan Kincaid finds

Running away to an isolated village in Baja California, heiress Judith

Detective Jo O'Neal and investigative reporter Simon Faro go

Discovering his missing racehorse grazing in Dynasty Jones's

Original.

When television film critic Jack Jacobs finds himself paired with his

The matchmaking computer team of Einstein and PINK bring together an

Realizing that he must play with fire to attain his wildest dreams,

Hired by handsome local troublemaker Jake Blessing, lawyer Divinity
Brown is forced to stake her career on a man with a tarnished

Original.

Returning to the hometown she had fled in shame with her newborn

When his time machine causes a fatal mishap, Chuck Della Croce travels

Chelsea Spencer watches in amazement as Johnny Anziano tackles the

book_title: Elizabeth and Jessica Run Away (Sweet Valley Kids, 31)

Summary:
Working at the day-care center to buy a new hair piece for their

will pay for the hair and the ...

After Molly, the twins' babysitter, has a fight with Jack, her

Tris and her mage-student, a young man whose glassmaking magic has

book_title: Count on Clifford (Clifford the Big Red Dog (Paperback))

book_title: Clifford's Halloween (Clifford the Big Red Dog)

Clifford begins life as a very small, red puppy, but once he starts

book_title: Clifford's Pals (Clifford the Big Red Dog (Paperback))

book_title: Clifford Gets a Job (Clifford the Big Red Dog (Paperback))

book_title: Clifford, the Big Red Dog (Clifford the Big Red Dog (Paperback))

Emily Elizabeth loves her huge dog Clifford even though he's far

book_title: Vampires and Other Creatures of the Night

book_title: Prince and the Pauper (Walt Disney Classics)
Summary: MOVIE/TV TIE-INS

book_title: The Rescuers Down Under (Walt Disney's Classic)
Summary: MOVIE/TV TIE-INS

Presents the story of the first Thanksgiving as celebrated by the

When Spider's teacher, Miss Quito, forgets to bring a turkey to

Summary:
Facts and fun about the presidents is jampacked with fascinating

Among the animals featured are giant dragonflies and a flying bat that

By cutting and grinding the wheat for flour, Jack starts from scratch

book_title: Santa Claus Doesn't Mop Floors (Adventures of the Bailey School Kids (Paperback))
Summary:
The third-graders at Bailey Elementary School wonder if Mr. Jolly, the

Includes general information, jokes, and brief descriptions of the

When an overseas telephone conversation traps Veronica into agreeing

book_title: A Very Scary Haunted House (Glows in the Dark)

During the summer Albie learns to swim the whole length of the pool

For two sisters growing up surrounded by the Civil War, there is

book_title: Shark Lady: True Adventures of Eugenie Clark

A biography of the ichthyologist whose interest in fish began at the

Santa's elves are making the toy dinosaurs all wrong, and Rex

Mary Anne wants to learn about her mother, who died when Mary Anne was

. . .

Karen and her class can't wait for the class trip to the zoo.
Baby-Sitters Little Sister #24

When Claudia comes home to find that her room has been ransacked and

Stoneybrook is paralyzed by a massive blizzard, but it's Stacey

When Stacey's best friend from New York, Laine Cummings, spends a

book_title: Claudia and the Genius of Elm Street (Baby-Sitters Club, 49)

Hired to baby-sit seven-year-old Rosie Wilder, Claudia is at first

Mallory has an important writing project to do and needs some quiet

Two crazy pigs tease the farmer and all the other animals.

book_title: The Haunted Cabin Mystery #20 (The Boxcar Chilrdren)

Summary:

book_title: The Forgotten Heroes: The Story of the Buffalo Soldiers

book_title: Saturday Is Ballet Day (My Pretty Ballerina)

This behind-the-scenes study of the Constitutional Convention of 1787

book_title: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde and Other Stories of the Supernatural

book_title: Where's That Reptile? (Hide & Seek Science, No 2)

book_title: Discovering Mars: The Amazing Story of the Red Planet

book_title: The Earth and Sky (First Discovery Book)

Summary:

book_title: The Turkey That Ate My Father

book_title: The Werewolf of Fever Swamp (Goosebumps, No 14)

There are strange noises coming from Fever Swamp. Then there was the

book_title: Karen's Big City Mystery (Baby-Sitters Little Sister, 99)

book_title: Karen's Show and Share (Baby-Sitters Little Sister, 109)

Durante su estadiá con su peculiar tía-abuela Katheryn, Evan va a una

Summary:

Summary: Visits an underwater volcano that eventually creates an island

Original. This is a collection of seven horrifying stories by seven

When Thora, a young worker bee, befriends some drones, she wonders if

book_title: Jos Story Portraits of Little Women

As an orphan, young Jonathan looks forward to starting life anew and

When Leo the lion, King of the Beasts, ignores his subjects,

Receiving a magical necklace from her grandmother, Little Star, who

Original. Movie tie-in.

book_title: The Amazing Panda Adventure (Hello Reader! Level 3 Grades 1 & 2)

First published 1981. Tells the story from the point of view of
ferrets, stoats and weasels of the Wild Wood

In the final volume of the Circle of Magic series, Briar, a young
mage-in-training, and his teacher Rosethorn must use their magic to
fight a deadly plague that is ravaging Summersea.

Penny Black is delighted to meet her long, lost Uncle who is full of
amazing stories - but Uncle Bumpo is not what he first appears!
Suggested level: primary.

Briar, a young mage-in-training, and his teacher Rosethorn must use
their magic to fight a deadly plague that is ravaging Summersea.

book_title: Pochacco and Friends: Silly Time Races (Sanrio)
Summary:
The series has proved exceptionally successful in commercial terms.
The books are written by Terry D... more »eary and illustrated by

book_title: The Children Next Door (Hippo Ghost S.)
Summary:
Shortlisted for the W.H.Smith Mind Boggling Award 1995 this story

book_title: The Lamb and the Butterfly (Blue Ribbon Book)
Summary:
A protected lamb and an independent butterfly discuss their different

book_title: Tick Tock, You're Dead! (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 2)
Summary:
A terrifying tour through a medieval castle, a close-up look at

book_title: Trapped in Bat Wing Hall (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 3)

book_title: A Light in the Storm: The Civil War Diary of Amelia Martin, Fenwick Island, Delaware, 1861 (Dear America)
Summary:

After a serious traffic accident, Lucy faces a series of painful

Miss Spider proves that her heart knows best when it comes to choosing

Participating in a fun skit for a school Halloween bash, a teenage

book_title: Death Comes to Dinner (Scene of the Crime, No 1)

Summary:
Deciding to go to the same Halloween costume store where his friend

Loving Hill House, an enormous tourist attraction that is reputed to

book_title: The Abominable Snowman of Pasadena (Goosebumps, No 38)
Summary:
Becoming sick of the endless hot weather in their Pasadena home,

book_title: Night of the Living Dummy III (Goosebumps, No 40)
Summary:
Trina O'Dell's dad has lots of dummies in the attic from his

book_title: The Beast from the East (Goosebumps, No 43)
Summary:
Getting lost in the woods with her identical twin brothers, Ginger
Wald wonders why their portion of the woods contains such bizarre

Hoping to fit in at Camp Spirit Moon despite its weird traditions,

control. Original.

book_title: How to Kill a Monster (Goosebumps, No 46)
Summary:
Gretchen and her stepbrother, Clark, hate staying at their
grandparents' house. There's something odd about the upstairs

book_title: Legend of the Lost Legend (Goosebumps, No 47)
Summary:
Justin and Marissa Clarke are on an adventure trip in Brovania with

Drew and her best friend Walker have planned the perfect Halloween

book_title: How I Learned to Fly (Goosebumps, No 52)
Summary:

book_title: The Curse of Camp Cold Lake (Goosebumps, No 56)
Summary:

book_title: My Best Friend Is Invisible (Goosebumps, No 57)
Summary:

book_title: The Mystery of the Lost Mines #52 (The Boxcar Children)
Summary:

With teammates no other team wants and her mother for a coach,
Catherine's baseball dreams are compromised when chaos erupts and

The Dumb Bunnies have a very active day, during which they do many
things backwards or wrong.

The Dumb Bunnies have a very active day, during which they do many
things backwards or wrong.

Unable to believe their luck when they read an ad that claims they can

afraid and never learns to swim.

Frozen statues by day and dedicated protectors by night, the gargoyles

In spite of his dislike of the snow, Hopper is a little rabbit who
enjoys playing with a friend and searching for food with his family.

When the Martians join the Waterloo Junior Hockey League, they must
work hard to prove themselves not only because of their team name, but
also because of their wacky coach named "Boom Boom"
Bolitsky, in the first installment of an exciting ...

"Chipmunk" Adelman doesn't believe Happer Feldman's
prediction that the Mars School hockey team will never touch the
league cup, until a series of unexpected events turns against the
team.

book_title: Polar Bears Past Bedtime (Magic Tree House # 12)
Summary:
Their magic tree house takes Jack and Annie to the Arctic, where a
polar bear leads them onto very thin ice

The experience of a small girl growing up in a Canadian city during
the thirties, based on the author's own memories.

Elizabeth, a beautiful princess, is all set to marry Ronald, her
prince, when a dragon comes along and forces her to rethink her plans.
Suggested level: preschool, junior.

After their car plunges down a steep cliff into Suicide Gulch, five
students try to survive in the bleak British Columbia mountains until
one of them can climb back up the cliff to get help.

Worried about her homework assignment to write about her strangest
dream, Jennifer falls asleep on the school bus.

All these things and more - make a rich and varied life for young
Willie Adams. Find out what it was like to live in Northern Ontario in
1888 in this book by the award-winning author of the popular Booky
trilogy and Amy's Promise.

book_title: The Craft of Children's Writing (Bright Idea)
Summary: Grade level: 1, 2, 3, k, p, e, t.

Finding the wounded rebel in the barn was just the beginning of
Deborah's troubles.

Alison senses a presence in the forbidding old house. She finds an old
journal written by a girl who lived in the mansion in 1810. What does
she want, and why is she so sure only Alison can help her? Grades 5-8.

Edward's eldest sister, Mary, soon challenged Jane for the throne,
with tragic results. This is the true story of a bright and
intelligent young woman who was manipulated and betrayed by the
ambitious people who surrounded her.

Another adventure featuring Carol Weatherspoon, Wally Stutzgummer, and
the dreaded Campbell twins. In Ottawa to take part in a BMX
conference, Carol meets up with a real life Middle-Eastern prince who
falls instantly in love with her.
Grade level: 4, 5, 6, 7, e, i.
You will discover the techniques used to solve mysteries of history.

After Dawn's mom marries MaryAnne's dad, the two friends,
suddenly sisters, find their home turned into a battlefield, until
Dawn realizes that her new stepsister only needs some room in which to
breathe.

book_title: Kristy and the Secret of Susan (Baby-Sitters Club, 32)
Summary:
Kristy is torn between her feelings for Susan, the young autistic girl

book_title: Mary Anne and Too Many Boys (Baby-Sitters Club, 34)
Summary:
Mary Anne and Stacey cannot conceive that too many boys in one place

With Jessi's mother going back to work full-time, Jessi's Aunt
Cecilia moves in with the Ramseys to help out, and Jessi is upset by

to have a "baby-sitter" of her own.

Covers how use of real books help children enjoy literature and
learning.

Someone is sending anonymous love letters to Kristy. Is it a practical
joke or do the letters mean something more? Copyright © Libri GmbH.
All rights reserved.

Mallory's dad just lost his job and the baby-sitters want to do
something to make her feel better. Copyright © Libri GmbH. All rights
reserved.

Neil really wants a dog, but all he has is his goldfish Fido, a bratty
five-year-old sister named Tara, and a brand new baby brother.

Orphaned Luke goes to live with his uncle, a practical man who
believes that dreaming is for fools.

book_title: Magic School Bus Taking Flight: A Book About Flight (Magic School Bus (Paper))
Summary:
Join Ms. Frizzle and the Magic School Bus gang for some higher

book_title: The Magic School Bus Going Batty: A Book About Bats (Magic School Bus)
Summary: The class is learning about nocturnal animals--creatures of the night.

book_title: The Human Body: A First Discovery Book (First Discovery Book)

A detailed and straightforward guide to the human body helps young

book_title: Recess Mess (Hello Reader! (DO NOT USE, please choose level and binding))

little brother appears.

book_title: The Day the Dog Said, \Cock-A-Doodle Doo!\" (Hello Reader! (DO NOT USE, please choose level and binding))"
Summary: The farm animals are bored until a big wind strikes the barnyard.

book_title: West to a Land of Plenty: The Diary of Teresa Angelino Viscardi, New York to Idaho Territory, 1883 (Dear America)
Summary:
The first humorous book in the Dear America series, "West to a

book_title: Still More Tales to Give You Goosebumps: Ten Spooky Stories (Goosebumps Special Edition, No 4)
Summary:
Will Charlie's recipe for pumpkin juice cause him some hair-

book_title: Even More Tales to Give You Goosebumps: Ten Spooky Stories (Goosebumps Special Edition, No 3)
You Be the Jury: Courtroom V
Summary:
The reader is provided evidence for ten courtroom cases, and must

book_title: There's a Cow in My Swimming Pool
Summary:
Nicole knows that she should not have a party while her parents are

book_title: Science Is...: A source book of fascinating facts, projects and activities
Summary:
Provides detailed information and instructions for performing a
variety of experiments in physics, the environment, geology, biology,

book_title: What Do the Fairies Do With All Those Teeth
Summary:
Asking the child's ever-famous question of what happens to their

A how-to-read book for beginners.

book_title: One Snowy Day (Hello Reader! (DO NOT USE, please choose level and binding))

When David visits his cousin in Mexico, he not only celebrates the Day

book_title: The Second Bend in the River (Point)
Summary:
In 1798 Rebecca, a young settler in the Ohio territory, meets the

Summary:
Snagging jobs as assistant cooks at a camp crawling with weird

Original.

When someone who calls himself "The Candyman" begins to sell
candy to hungry fellow campers at outrageous prices, assistant cooks

ordinary shish kebob. Original.

Enter Jack, returned from the dead after months in a coma. With total
amnesia, he's a stranger in his own life, And the way people react

Experiments and activities introduce the basic principles of

book_title: The Girl Who Cried Monster (Goosebumps Presents TV Episode #1)
Summary:
Then one day, Lucy discovers a real, live monster--the librarian in

book_title: Welcome to Camp Nightmare (Goosebumps Presents TV Book #3)

When he can't find his cat to enter in the neighborhood pet show,

A collection of children's books on the subject of fables, folk

When an efficient duck who gives the time over the telephone gets

The Berenstain Bears learn about nature as they hike through Bear

book_title: Who Lives in the Arctic (Science Emergent Readers)

Photographs and simple text explore the variety of animals that have

Photographs and simple text invite the reader to count penguins

Simple text and photographs present the life cycle of a frog.

book_title: Postman Pat's Sore Tooth (Postman Pat Easy Reader S.)

book_title: Goosebumps Triple Header Book 2: Three Shocking Tales of Terror

Attending the reading of his father's will, Tobias learns that his

The Yeerks are causing problems at the North Pole, so the Animorphs

In what is supposed to be a battle to end all battles, the Animorphs

The Animorphs have no ally more powerful than Erek the Chee. But now

The Yeerks are attempting to create a biological catalyst that will
reduce the annoying human tendency to express free will.
Marco's mom has been demoted.

Ray blasts off into space, where he crash lands on a strange planet

Text and photographs chronicle the social history of female athletes,

book_title: Sad Song of the Whale (Green Watch)

Tim leaps at the chabce to join Green Watch on an anti-whaling

If you thought you'd seen 'em all, think again! Find over 100

Photographs and text present an up-close look at varied aspects of the

Brandon thinks his impersonation of a headless freak is the height of

book_title: Attack of the Graveyard Ghouls (Goosebumps Series 2000, No 11)

book_title: It's Only a Nightmare! (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 32)
Summary:
Readers are placed in the character of a young person who is spending

book_title: You're Invited to Mary-Kate & Ashley's Christmas Party (You're Invited to Mary-Kate & Ashley's)

Join Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen and their friends for a Christmas

Photographs and simple text depict a variety of camouflaged animals in

book_title: The Things Birds Eat (Science Emergent Readers)

Simple text and photographs present birds eating a variety of things,

book_title: You Can Yo-Yo! Twenty-five Tricks to Try!
Summary:

book_title: Liz Looks for a Home: Scholastic's the Magic School Bus (Magic School Bus (Paperback))
Summary:
When Ralphie forget's Liz's habitat, he sets about finding her
a new home

book_title: Scooby-Doo and the Haunted Castle (Scooby-Doo Mysteries, 1)
Summary:
In a chilling new case for Scooby and his sleuthing friends, the gang

ghost turns out the lights. Original.

book_title: Scooby-Doo and the Mummy's Curse (Scoody-Doo Mysteries, 2)
Summary:
Shaggy, Scooby-Doo, and the rest of the gang visit the movie set of an

that a mummy's curse is sabotaging the production. Original.

book_title: Scooby-Doo! and the Snow Monster (Scooby-Doo Mysteries, 3)
Summary:
On a weekend ski trip, Scooby-Doo and the gang find that rumors about

When Kit becomes the unwitting guardian of a young baby, thanks to her

book_title: Cleopatra VII: Daughter of the Nile, Egypt, 57 B.C. (The Royal Diaries)

Written in a diary-style format, this work presents the experiences

book_title: My Hairiest Adventure (Goosebumps Presents TV Book #6)
Summary:
When Larry and his friends find an old bottle of Insta-Tan, they

book_title: We Are Witnesses: Five Diaries of Teenagers Who Died in the Holocaust
Summary:
World War II Jewish teens David, Yitzhak, Moshe, Eva, and Anne tell

book_title: Hercules the Strong Man (Myth Men - Guardians of the Legend , No 1)
Summary:
The strongest man in the world, half-god Hercules battles a host of

Original.

Text and illustrations describe all sorts of trucks used in building a
house, on the highway, on a farm, at a fire, and in other places.

When their math teacher sends them to see the principal, two boys risk
further punishment by following a new girl who has disappeared into
the lost and found bin looking for her lucky hat.

book_title: The Adventures of Captain Underpants: An Epic Novel (Captain Underpants)
Summary:
Captain Underpants, the former school principal turned crime-fighting,

book_title: The Dumb Bunnies Go to the Zoo
Summary:
When the Dumb Bunnies visit the zoo they let all the animals out of

book_title: The Curse of the Creeping Coffin (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 8)
Summary:
Readers are placed into the life of a character who visits Grandmother

book_title: The Knight in Screaming Armor (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 9)
Summary:
In an interactive adventure with more than twenty scary endings,

book_title: Diary of a Mad Mummy (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 10)
Summary:
Readers are placed in the character of a young person who discovers an

book_title: Deep in the Jungle of Doom (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 11)
Summary:
Join some kids on a major cvlass trip to the jungles of South America,

book_title: Welcome to the Wicked Wax Museum (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 12)
Summary:
Reader experiences the adventures of visiting a wax museum, where

book_title: The Creepy Creations of Professor Shock (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 14)
Summary:
You are invited to choose one of 20 spooky endings as you and your

book_title: Secret Agent Grandma (Give Yourself Goosebumps, No 16)
Summary: Choose your own scary ending for yet another horror story.

book_title: I Am Fire (Hello Reader! Science. Level 1)
Summary:
